items.headline: Why junk bonds right now might paradoxically be a way of reducing risk with stocks at record highs
items.summary_en: High-yields bonds historically have half the volatility of stocks and also outperform during low-growth periods.

items.headline: Fiserv attracted hot money ahead of 44% stock-price nosedive
items.summary_en: Fiserv, the fintech whose stock dived 44% on Wednesday after a profit warning, was bought by hedge funds who actively trade stocks prior to the collapse.

items.headline: What’s in the Trump-Xi agreement struck on fentanyl, rare-earths, shipbuilding
items.summary_en: The agreement stuck between President Donald Trump and Chinese leader Xi Jinping in South Korea on Thursday includes an agreement to reduce U.S. tariffs put on China overselling a precursor to fentanyl as well as a halt to shipbuilding levies for a year.

items.headline: Ellen DeGeneres’ former $35 million oceanfront mansion is back on the market
items.summary_en: Perched atop a bluff above the ocean, the home boasts 77 feet of beach on the California coast known as “Billionaires’ Beach” thanks to the extraordinary net worth of its residents.

items.headline: I received an inheritance from my father’s estate, but the executor wants me to give it back. What should I do?
items.summary_en: “The attorney for my late father stated that all beneficiaries needed to wait 10 months before disbursements from the sale of the home could be released.”

items.headline: I’m a veteran, 57, and on disability benefits. How do I persuade my wife, 52, to downsize so we can both retire?
items.summary_en: “I am now medically disabled/retired and receive $2,100 a month from Social Security.”

items.headline: ‘I fear a significant decline in the S&P 500’: Do I sell my tech stocks before it’s too late?

items.headline: ‘Luckily, I did not mix our finances’: My husband is 7 years younger and has dementia. What happens now?
items.summary_en: “I have gotten our living expenses as low as I can, and I have dental and healthcare insurance for both of us.”

items.headline: My late husband’s parents left me nothing in their will. Am I wrong to think they are thoughtless?
